newsitem.title: USA: NatWest raises W.R. Grace to trading buy.
newsitem.headline: NatWest raises W.R. Grace to trading buy.

text.p: NatWest Securities said it raised its rating on W.R. Grace & Co to trading buy from hold ahead of the company's spinoff of its National Medical Care unit and that unit's merger with Fresenius AG.

"After the expected spin and a $2.2 billion cash distribution to Grace, we believe the stock has an opportunity to beat the market over the next few months because of an aggressive share repurchase during that time, the possibility of more asset sales and possible new coverage by packaging analysts which may value the the earnings higher," the brokerage said in a research note.
"In short, lots of good news is expected," NatWest said.
Shares of W.R. Grace were up 3/4 at 70-1/8.
